intro: Dianthus japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese carnation, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of eastern Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant appearance. Dianthus japonicus is also valued for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
